If I get it returned from them unfixed, this controller will, unfortunately, end up with a 1 star from me. Right now, it's a waiting game. I will know whether it's great or not on Tuesday.Update: I am on my third controller now. I have a 100% rate of unresponsive buttons with every controller I've gotten. On replacement from Amazon and one straight from Microsoft. Do not waste your money on this product. I thought that, after a year, Microsoft would've fixed the issues they acknowledged with this controller, but they have not. They are just ripping you off. They are selling a product that they know is defective.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I was scared and skeptical about this controller but the fixed everything that was wrong the the original and the stuff that just needed to be tweaked a bit. This is a great controller and would tell everyone and anyone that is worth it, any real gamer will go through regular controllers like water because they are cheaply made of all plastic. No lie I used to have to buy a new controller every 1-2 months because the toggles would get damaged so bad from rubbing plastic on plastic, the only controller this didn’t happen with is the day one controller that came with the system. They didn’t use the same grade of cheap plastic that they use now on the regular controllers somehow it was sturdy and lasted until the internal components gave out. In my opinion yes it is expensive but if you don’t have to buy another controller for at least a year doesn’t that save you a lot of money, not to mention the great quality of the controller! I say this is worth buying no matter what type of player you are!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought the controller open box like new. It was everything except like new. The LB and RB button were broken and jammed, in the left stick there was horrendous stick drift and was unusable. On top of that the controller shell was broken and cracked too. All packaging was fine. Whoever does quality checks needs to do a better job.Good thing Microsoft was able to send me a new controller with warranty.I will never use this company again and would caution anyone who does in the future.

CommentsTitle: Unresponsive A B X Y Buttons! WIDESPREAD ISSUE!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2020
CommentsContent: Ordered this controller thinking it was going to be amazing seeing the good reviews on here. But after it arrived late, I tried it and instantly could tell something was wrong. I looked up how big the issue with buttons is and if there is a fix... there isn't. This issue is extremely widespread. Can't believe a 180 dollar "premium" product is so awful and Microsoft obviously doesn't care about fixing these issues since the controller has been out for 3 months and its been an issue since day 1. Extremely disappointed.

CommentsTitle: You will not regret buying this. Believe me.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ll preface this by saying I’ve used scuff before and have a bit of comparison. For the money, you’re not getting a better pro controller. I used the Elite now 3 months and it has made a world of difference. I exclusively play COD: Warzone and it has enhanced my game experience tremendously. Firstly, the controller looks and feels high quality. Rubberized grips, metallic paddles and high quality plastic perforated triggers. Secondly, the level of customization is god tier. Changing out the joy sticks for different sizes, adding and eliminating back paddles, quick setting your trigger distance, Xbox software to lower your vibrations and easily program the back paddles, increasing the tension on the joysticks. ALL SUPER EASY AND QUICK. They literally give you the tools to do it. Listen, I play A LOT of COD and I’ve used scuf before. This is far far superior and so much easier to customize for such a reasonable price. If you can afford a Battle Beaver, go for it. But for the price, you’re not getting a better pro controller. My game has changed so much that I can rep this controller enough. My only gripe is that Sony can’t friggin do the same!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2020
CommentsContent: Straight out of the box everything works perfectly.  No sticky buttons or triggers and no stick drift. If this changes in the future I will update the review.Now that MS have extended the warranty length to a full year from purchase, I felt confident enough to buy this Elite series 2.On a side note, something that I found interesting was that it is slightly smaller than the Elite 1 controller. I noticed it very quickly; not a detrimental thing but unexpected on my part.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2020
CommentsContent: Purchased for use with my windows 10 pc and replaced my old series 1 xbox elite controller.Out of the box I greatly enjoyed the ability to change the tension on the control sticks, really changes the feel of the controller, hated how "floaty" the old one felt.However, one glaring flaw is how frequent the controller disconnects randomly, even with a full charge. The controller will simply drop for 5 seconds until it can reconnect, which is simply unacceptable with an over $200 entry fee. I updated the control firmware as well as updated windows 10 in the hopes for a fix. No go.My computer is a newly released laptop only 6 months old and has no issues with any other bluetooth electronics. Controller works well when plugged in, although there is also a strange rattling noise when using the d-pad, like something is loose inside.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 21, 2020
CommentsContent: So I bought this controller because my friends have the series 1 and love it and it had a year warranty. So I bought this controller after going through a bunch of the $60.00 Controllers because the thumb sticks kept drifting.Got the controller worked great, felt great everything was good. Well a couple months later the sticks was drifting a little bit not bad and adjusted it in the controller settings then after 3 months the Left thumb stick is mostly non responsive and the buttons are sticking, plus the short throw slider switch fell apart but easily fixed. Of course now the controller is out of warranty after 90 days and is $100.00 to repair/replace while Microsoft is still deciding it policy on these controllers. Definitely not worth the money for a controller that I would not consider for professional gamers when a hobbyist is having issues with it with minimal use. Not to mention when contacted customer service Microsoft is still figuring out how to deal with all the repair requests and complaints about the warranty so basically stuck in limbo till they figure it out.

CommentsTitle: Quality Control issues strike again! Save your $$ for now
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Been through 2 already. 1st had a spongy and squeaky right trigger when using the hair trigger. Also a crunch/grind when using the left thimb stick and rotating it when maxed in a direction. Next was overly slick analog sticks and a sticky finish on the controller. Annnd it would disconnect randomly.Second one had a spongy left trigger,  and suffered form the desyncs also.Battery life was amazing and the tension adjustments for the analogs were nice! But for the price it's ridiculous to suffer from any one issue let alone multiple. Wait for a sale or look elsewhere, sadly.

CommentsTitle: Great controller, but falling apart after 6 months
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2020
CommentsContent: Pros:-Controller feels great.-The adjustable trigger depth is a game changer.Cons:-After 5 months of use the right bumper started "double-clicking".-A month later the right trigger started to stick.-The rubber on the trigger depth adjustment has come off.-From the start the controller had difficulty connecting to the Xbox (it's an old xbox though so who knows)This is through normal use; it just sits on my desk otherwise (and I'm not throwing my controller). I'd expect a $150+ controller to last longer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 21, 2020
CommentsContent: For the 180+ your spending buy a normal controller and save your money.The elite 2 has so many issues.Out of the box it has massive stick drift. Buttons stick and stay stuck. The trigger lock rubber falls off.One of my sticks doesn’t register in the up posterior at all.Overall terrible buy.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: I got this on Halloween and I must say this is the best Xbox Controller I've had. From the way it feels to the additional parts, this is easily the best controller on the market. What kills it is the lack of durability. Anyone who has done research on this controller knows about the numerous occasions of this controller arriving broken on their doorstep. In my case, I had stick drift in both sticks and the A button was sucked. Surprisingly, the A button stopped being stuck after further use, however the Left Thumbstick is practically broken for me after 2 and a half months of using it. I can't do a full rotation without feeling some sort of hitch with the stick. Thankfully, Microsoft extended the warranty on this for a whole year now and I was able to get a replacement. My final verdict, is that you should be cautious about ordering this controller since it's almost $200 here. If you do want an advanced controller, this is easily the best one out there, but beware of durability issues and make sure you register the controller on Xbox.com.

CommentsTitle: Microsoft Nails It, Apple Blows It
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2020
CommentsContent: So many upgrades from the first generation and I absolutely love how this controller fits in my hand.  Unfortunately, I also purchased this for use on my iPhone due to Bluetooth compatibility but as of this review it still doesn’t work.  From what I’ve researched it comes down to some dummy at Apple not putting it on a list of supported controllers.  Otherwise this controller is great and I never want to use another non-elite controller ever!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2020
CommentsContent: Absolutely one of the worst controller mistakes I've made. At least the series one lasted me 6 months without issues. This is my third Xbox elite controller, first and only series 2. I've had this thing since February and already one of the rear paddles don't work and the B, rb and one of the other paddles only work sometimes. If youre in the market for a controller with mappable buttons on the back, go with the 40 dollar fusion a rgb one. It's 40 bucks and the buttons feel better. And if that one breaks, it's 40 bucks not 180 plus 100 to fix it when it breaks.

CommentsTitle: Worth the money even for an old dude
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 20, 2020
CommentsContent: I own the first Xbox One Elite controller and have been very happy with it but have been somewhat annoyed at the paddles on the bottom of the controller as I accidentally press them.This new version of the controller shortened the length of those paddles which was a big improvement.All of the other little changes Microsoft made to this controller have been very nice.I am an old guy and am not a super hard core gamer so I’m not capable of responding to pro level expectations.  From the viewpoint of an average guy, this controller is very much worth it.I play about six hours a week.  Given that, the cost per day becomes economical.  My first elite worked seamlessly for almost two years (and is was working when I retired it) and I expect similar performance from this controller.

CommentsTitle: This is a horrible product and Microsoft will not support it.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2020
CommentsContent: Microsoft is the worst company I have ever done business with. My son received an Xbox series 2 Elite Controller for Christmas 2019. Microsoft provided a 90 day warranty for it. The controller stopped working in March but, since we reside in the New Rochelle containment zone, we were more concerned with the global pandemic of COVID than with the controller. When we contacted Microsoft, they have absolutely no interest in helping up. They do not care that the world shut down for COVID and they will not stand behind their product which stopped functioning within the 90 warranty period, again, DURING, a worldwide pandemic. They are charging me $110 to have the controller repaired and they will only guarantee the controller will work for 30 days after the repair. The original price for the controller was $180. DO NOT BUY THIS CONTROLLER! DO NOT BUY MICROSOFT PRODUCTS! They will not stand behind their products.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 11, 2020
CommentsContent: The Elite 1 sticks does not work on the Elite 2; is a big deal because the stick selection is not duplicated from the Elite 1.  Elite 1 paddles work on the Elite 2 which I prefer over the smaller paddles provided with the Elite 2.  The stiffer joystick settings are not desirable to me so I'm using the Elite 1 setting.  The biggest deal breaker is the converters to use it on a PS4 does not work.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2020
CommentsContent: This controller was for my teenage son.  The number three paddle (P3) did not work on the first one and we sent it back and got a refund.  About a month later my son wanted to try again, thinking maybe a second controller would work.  He really wanted this controller, but he wanted one that would work.  On the second controller the face buttons (a, b, x, y) did not work (maybe sometimes if you press them just the right way), so we sent it back and got a refund.  That is two defective controllers in a row.  If this controller worked, my son would give it five stars.  Since none of them worked, even one star is too high a rating.  If you get one of these, pay attention to the 30 day time period you have to send it back.  Test it well and make sure it is working correctly as you approach the end of the 30 day return window or you could be stuck with a $180 piece of junk.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I've owned this for 2 months now and the left thumbstick is already faulty. I get drift (inputs registered when the stick is in the resting position) and inputs from the stick are sometimes not registered at all when in the max position. There's a current class action lawsuit about this issue affecting every single xbox one controller, and support is swamped so I will have to deal with this for quite some time before it gets fixed. The warranty from MS is only 4 months, which is insane for how much this costs. It should be a full 1 year at the very least. If by December the issue is not fixed, I will have to solder on a 3rd party thumbstick myself.If you want to game competitively, do not buy this controller until the drift issue is fixed.Aside from that, the controller feels great in my hands and the level of customization is awesome. I still use this over a playstation controller, because the PS controller is just so awkward to use imo.

CommentsTitle: Strong don't buy great controller but poor quality
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2020
CommentsContent: Don't not buy these overpriced poorly made pieces of junk had 2 now after 3 month each of them had the left stick go bad.. I also Had an Elite 1 that went bad after a year that's 3 for 3 can't just be bad luck I have had regular Xbox xbox360 and Xbox one controllers that come with the systems and have never had one break or go bad on me so it's not me the Elite is just a poor product not worth the expensive price my advice is to just get the dominator pack if you want paddles.

CommentsTitle: 3 month warranty for a $200 high use electronic? BEWARE!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2020
CommentsContent: 3 month warranty on a device that's supposed to last thousands of hours of use? What a joke. I had problems with this controller from day #1, and they have really got bad as of the past couple weeks. I've owned it for 5 months. Doing a repair through Xbox is about $125 and a replacement is nearly $200. I've been an Xbox fan since Halo , but this type of lack of commitment to their product, I think I'm officially done. BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK!

CommentsTitle: Amazon sent me a used one or Microsoft has bad quality control.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2021
CommentsContent: Either this was used and amazon sent me a used one or microsoft's quality control is just really bad. The replaceable thumb sticks had multiple scratches on it like it was used by a person. Had multiple scratches on the buttons. Other than that this thing did feel nice to use and hold. I suggest if you can afford it then buy it. Just hope that you don't get one like me. I ended up returning it and getting it replaced and the new one seemed fine with no issues.

CommentsTitle: Worthless. Do not waste your money.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2020
CommentsContent: Do not waste your money! Just like the Elite 1, am overpriced controller that you really get your hopes up about. Stick drift....yet again. Both controllers. So disappointing, because the controller feels so well made and it’s difficult to go back to normal one after getting used to the paddles.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2021
CommentsContent: Unfortunately, trying to get it to pair to anything or stay paired is nearly impossible. First off you have to use the Xbox Accessories application to do ANYTHING which can only be installed via the MS store which requires you to be on specific versions of Windows. If you've debloated your Windows install, this is incredibly frustrating. Once you DO go through all the hassle of getting Windows updated to the specific version it wants and the MS Store working and downloading the app to update the firmware of the controller you might be able to start using it. Sometimes the controller just decides it doesn't want to advertise though. My PC can see and connect to other Bluetooth peripherals but multiple PCs cant see the Xbox controller for no discernible reason.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2020
CommentsContent: The controller worked for about 3 days and the buttons started malfunctioning. Never buy a used controller even if it says like new it was returned for a reason.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2020
CommentsContent: There are many things to like and love about this remote... I had high expectations and it definitely came with a lot of hype. Used it for 6 months moderately and the left bumper button started sticking and within a week... nothing. I was forced to tear it apart to try to salvage it with cleaning. It was unusable and out of warranty. Didn't work! $175 for a remote that lasted 6 months... Never again. Microsoft swore that they fixed the issues... didn't pan out for me. Deeply saddened and a lot lighter in the wallet now that I have to buy ANOTHER remote.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I have tried everything I can to fix this or remedy the problem,  but the controller drifts forward.  I've even used the controller mapping device and it verifies it,  but can't correct it.Back to the cheap controllers,  don't waste your money unless you like running off cliffs.A little research finds this to be a common issue with this controller that has no solution.

CommentsTitle: Warehouse Refurbished, Arrived Dirty and Not Refurbished at All
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2020
CommentsContent: Ordered this yesterday hoping it'd be a solid way to save some money on this controller, but overall was disappointed.The outer packaging was in great shape, but the controller itself was dirty and clearly uncleaned before being shipped back out. Had to spend a few minutes wiping it down and cleaning someone else's hand dirt out from the cracks before I could get to actually using it.When I plugged it in to the console, the previous owner's control profile was still active on the controller, and I realized the paddles were still attached, with one of the paddles not functioning properly.Long story short, while the Amazon Warehouse Refurbished/Renewed option is presented as a product that has been fixed or tended to, it appears to me as though in this case the item was simply a reboxed and reshipped return that never actually saw any sort of refurbishment whatsoever.Yes, you get a discount buying it this way, but no, it's not really ever acceptable to receive a product that looks as though it could have been pulled from the storage bins at a goodwill and that hasn't been refurbished when it's billed as so.EDIT: After initially posting this realized I did not receive a Series 2 at all, but a Series 1 in a series 2 box. So clearly what happened here was someone originally bought the Series 2, and returned their Series 1 with it, and rather than refurbish the product or even verify it was the product, Amazon just repackaged and sold it as a series 2. Unbelievable.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 18, 2020
CommentsContent: came without all elite series 2 thumbstick attachments which was a deal breaker for me, also came with cord that disconnected frequently thankfully i had another, insane stick drift on right analog, but i managed, until about a week into owing the controller, the rb bumper stoppped functioning correctly and would double tap almost every other actuation, and not even actuate at all other times... needed to return

CommentsTitle: Unresponsive face buttons and ridiculously complicated to customizing key maps
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I gambled myself to order it after reading threads of multiple problems.I received a model 1757 and had unresponsive face buttons, A and Y. I still wanted to try out new unit because I really loved the premium feeling.  However I decided to return it after trying to customize key maps.In Windows 10, you need to login as both Microsoft and Xbox Live accounts. Otherwise, you cannot configure (based on my research). During the process my local login password was corrupted and now I need to reset my PC.I'm very disappointed on my first premium gaming pad. It is not acceptable for premium pricing.

CommentsTitle: Terrible top of the line controller product
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020
CommentsContent: Aye, just straight up, don't waste your time buying this controller. It's not worth it.I had the controller for about 6 month, and during that time, it was awesome. Loved playing with it, however, my LB button suddenly just went out one day. I treat my controllers very well, and I don't do anything out of the ordinary with them. I noticed the issue when I was trying to switch inventory items in Minecraft. Thought it was just a weird thing with the game, even checked the control bindings. Found if I mashed it super hard, it would register the press. Then I went to play Rocket League where I very often use LB for air rolling while doing aerials and drifting on the ground. Found it wasn't registering my button presses there. Sent it in for repairs, got it back 2 weeks later where Microsoft straight up sent me a new controller. Not bad, figured if it came straight from Microsoft, should have no issues. I'm writing this after having the new controller for 2 days. I'm playing Rocket League again and this time the B button doesn't register all the time. I compared it with my brand new Series X controller I got since I was out of my Elite controller for 2 weeks while it was out and the Series X controller registers B every time I press it. Don't water your time, it's not worth the hassles you're going to have with it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2020
CommentsContent: Disconnects during play, and had stick drifting during play.The feel of it was great the software was trash.

CommentsTitle: If you want an elite controller buy the 1st one
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I ended up buying this back in January 2020 and right out of the box the left joystick was sticking and drifting. I sent it back in exchange for a new one. For the first few months the replacement worked fine. Then the little caps that cover the switches for the adjustability on the triggers fell off just leaving the little nubs where you have to flip the controller and pinch them to adjust the triggers. I didn't really care about that since I never used that feature. About May hits and the buttons feel like they are starting to stick an takes a little more of a firm press to use. At first I thought it was dirty but I always put it back and close the case when I'm not using it and wipe it down somewhat regularly. Starting around August the right bumper decided to stop working (I never dropped the controller or banged it on a table). It started where I got to FIRMLY press it to use it and even then majority of the time it still doesn't work. Recently on one of the last few days in September the right bumper just stopped working completely and I even started using this controller less going back the the basic one that came with my One X. When the Xbox One was initially released I bought the Elite bundle which came with the first elite controller and the entire time I had it and used it i had no issues. That is even with the occasional drop some being a little hard when the cord for my headset gets cought on the arm of my chair. I ended up selling it to a friend for really cheap and he still has no issues with it. On the plus side I've had no issues with Bluetooth connectivity which it sounds like is another issue these tend to have. Long story short for $180 it is not work it and your better of buying the 1st elite controller.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve had my Series 2 controller for about two months now. It came in perfect working condition and is still in perfect working condition. No signs of wear from use yet. It was a huge upgrade from the standard Xbox One controller. My accuracy and reaction times have increased dramatically simply because of switching to the Series 2.If you get sent a problematic controller then just send it back and get a new one. Repeat if necessary. The controller is well worth the hassle if you don’t get a perfect one right away. Stop being hesitant in buying one like I was. The poor quality reviews almost stopped me from having this wonderful device.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2021
CommentsContent: Solid construction, incredibly ergonomic and the controller profiles through the app make modifying this for personal use pretty much perfect.  I've read others having issues with stick drift, shoddy construction, and buttons failing after a lot of use.  Speaking only from my experience, which is almost daily gaming, and hard gaming use at that with competitive fortnite, but I've had no issues crop up!  This should honestly be the standard from which all future controllers draw from.  More buttons means more options and these paddles should be standard!

CommentsTitle: Don't buy it without a 20+ year warranty.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 7, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought this controller in February, return window closed in March. It's now August and the controller is not functional due to awful analog stick drift (left and right) and a buggy dpad. Movement and menu selecting is terrible when doing anything on the console, the controller, quite literally, plays itself. Amazon will direct you to Microsoft, Microsoft will direct you to Xbox, and Xbox has fully anticipated these kinds of problems for their shitty controller and will not allow you to call or chat with human being about their controller issues— you get stuck with a "virtual" agent which tells you nothing is possible because you're device has no warranty and you must buy a replacement. Thus the circle of hell repeats. For $180 this is a terrible product. Be prepared to constantly pay for a warranty, and be prepared to replace this controller every six months because what is quality control compared to lining their pockets?

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 12, 2020
CommentsContent: Amazing controller I love every part of it but seriously lacking in quality control.  Purchased the 1st week of February 2020 and failed in the first week of August 2020.  For $180 i expected it to last longer, only a 90day warranty so I am stuck with a broken controller.  The right trigger sticks and clicks, never spilled on taken great care of it.  I have never had this issue on any of my xbox controllers all the way back to the original XBOX.BUY THE EXTENDED COVERAGE!! After 90days you're on your own.I will buy again but with the 3 year coverage from Microsoft. That's how amazing this controller is i am going to buy another, not happy about it but i will.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2020
CommentsContent: This controller is amazing when it works. It feels much better than the standard controllers. The hair triggers make a big difference in shooting games and I like how easy it is to turn on them on and off. The ability to quickly set it up for different games with the additional paddles and sticks is just what I was looking for. I couldn't be happier. BUT within the first week the A button was sticking repeatedly just as seen in videos by other reviewers. I tried cleaning it out with a Q-tip and rubbing alcohol like Microsoft recommends, but it didn't change a thing. I don't think a company like Microsoft should expect a consumer to have to troubleshoot manufacturing issues right out of the box on a controller that cost 3 times that of a regular one. This controller is being returned until the manufacturing defects which appear to run rampant are fixed. 5 stars to Amazons return policy.

CommentsTitle: Squeeky noise on dpad... and broken RB button
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2020
CommentsContent: After about 2 months use, my dpad starts making noise whenever I press...Edit 4/6/20Consider before you buy it. I admit this is definitely a fancy and nice controller... ONLY IF there is no issueFirst one had sticky dpad with noisy sound. It got replaced under warranty.For second one, I used it about a month without issue, then RB starts double clicking randomly. Apparently, this is also known issue on this controller when I browsed it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2020
CommentsContent: The A and Y buttons had a tendency to be unresponsive when pressed. I was using this controller on PC, so I can't speak for how well it would work on consoles. While the build quality is good, all the extra parts make the controller uncomfortably heavy.  I went back to my old Xbox One controller and it works much better.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I had a Series 1 Xbox Elite Controller for several years. It served me well. I thought it was time to upgrade to a Series 2 Elite Controller. I had friends who were happy with their purchase. I purchased mine. It worked great for about 48 hours until I started to experience major drift in my left thumb stick. The drift is so bad that I cannot use my new controller. There is something wrong with the parts in the controller. I tried to compensation the drift through adjust things though the accessories app, but no luck. I cannot even use the controller on my home screen because the drift is so bad.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2019
CommentsContent: Coming from a regular Xbox controller, this thing is AMAZING! I exclusively play call of duty on my Xbox, so the extended stick, paddles, and adjustable triggers have been completely ground breaking for me. I will never go back to a regular controller again when playing competitively. As for the quality, it’s fantastic in every way possible! Really solid and nothing about it feels cheap. To take the removable parts on and off it’s magnetic and extremely satisfying to do. Sadly mine arrived and the circle dpad was 100% flush all around, but you can hardly notice it and doesn’t affect any type of gameplay. Even with that little quirk, I’d still give this controller 1000 stars if i could. I will never use another controller again

CommentsTitle: The controller that doesn't break in a week (It broke)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought this hoping to end my bad luck with many wired controllers that would quickly break on me. This controller is sturdy, feels great in your hand, and very customization. One small problem I have is that this controller does NOT work with windows 7 unless you have the old xbox one controller driver that is now no longer available. Microsoft claims it does right on their page but it just won't for a strong majority of people.The battery life is incredible on it however. It amazes me how long I have used it for so far without a charge on my xbox one x. It's a great purchase if you can justify spending 180 dollars on a controller that you can actually use without busting up for the foreseeable future.Edit: It broke. Thanks for nothing microsoft.... 180 dollars down the drain. Barely even used it.

CommentsTitle: Left stick drift within a week.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 8, 2020
CommentsContent: After about a week the controller developed  severe left stick drift. Microsoft agreed to replace the controller, paid for expedited shipping, ok cool. New controller arrived with worse left stick drift than the original, Microsoft agreed to replace it again, but I still had to pay for expedited shipping. Have had the new controller for about 3 weeks now without any further issues, but I only use it for one or two games, most of the time I use the previous version elite controller that has been in use for several years. For the price of the controller you would think Microsoft quality control testing might have been better. Next time I need another controller it will not be a Microsoft product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve received two of these controllers from Amazon, and both had an unreliable “A” button. Very frustrating, because the original Elite controller was great and this one is better in every way, but unresponsive inputs are not acceptable for a first party controller. Especially one that is almost $200.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2021
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Kinda torn over this remote, at first I was happily surprised by the build quality and variety of customization features this remote has to offer. However after about a month of use, it's starting to exhibit stick drift and it's getting annoying. Weirdly enough, even with the stick drift (see video), I still found myself using this remote more than the stock version. The remote really does feels much better and comfortable to play with. That being said, I didn't pay 170$ to play with a broken remote.  I wish Xbox could just give me a remote works. Will be returning.

CommentsTitle: The best controller money can buy
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I honestly can't say anything actually bad about this controller. It has tons of great features, it has plenty of options for various games, and it is very customizable and versatile. The only gripe I have is that with the way your left hand rests on the left grip with your thumb on the left joystick makes it a tiny bit awkward to press in the paddles, but I'm chalking that up to my very large hands and not the controller. A lot of people whine about the fact that there's some play in the joysticks but it isn't noticeable at all during gameplay and I can't imagine it actually affecting someone as there really isn't that much play at all. The battery life and charger are great, it was one of the sellibg points for me, and the case is really nice too. I don't feel conflicted saying that this is the best controller for any gaming system. It's highly presice, of excellent quality, and extremely practical.

CommentsTitle: Great from purchase in February to August - then Stick drift. I do not recommend this controller.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 29, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a feature rich control.I'm not a pro gamer, I play an hour or so a day, and not everyday of the week. The left stick started drifting about 2 weeks ago (second week of August 2020), so it was great for 6 months of  casual COD Warzone play, now the stick drift if REALLY annoying.I'd stay away from the Elite Series 2. For a premium price, it should have last more than 6 months. Microsoft and their Chinese manufacturer should be ashamed of the quality of this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2020

CommentsTitle: Substantial Thumbstick Drift Within Months of Use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I had the Elite Series 1 for almost five years, before mine crapped out, so I had high hopes for this controller. I used this controller daily for about four months, and within that time, I had issues with stick drift, especially on the left one. As I play a lot of FPS games, my player would either move with no input, or would not move in certain directions even with the stick input at max. I tried all sorts of in-game settings (like stick deadzones) and custom configurations within the app (response curves), but nothing really helped. I'm sure I'm probably in the minority for issues with this controller, but your mileage will most certainly vary. The issues that I experienced were unacceptable for a controller that costs almost as much as a console, and they cropped up outside of the 45-day warranty for the controller, so I would have paid almost as much in shipping, handling, and repairs as I would have for a new controller.My advice: save your money, and either by a Strike Pack for a standard controller, or go with the PowerA Fusion, if you don't playing with wired-only controllers. I got the latter a few months back. While the controller isn't as premium regarding build, customization, and software, you get paddles and on-the-fly remapping for less than half the price ($80), and I like the way the analog sticks feel more than the Elite Series 2. Or, save your money for the next-gen Series X.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2021
CommentsContent: I have had this for a while, and shame on me for not returning when I could. My model came with a malfunctioning bumper, its double and some times triple clicks the right bumper when a single, even quick press. It is more disappointing than anything even at this point some 6 months or so later. However it works, for the most part. Just don't try to set a passcode on your xbox with a bumper key, or throw a grenade in a video game.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I have bought 2 of these controllers and both have developed connectivity issues over time.  The most recent one started just a few weeks after light use.  Microsoft doesn't seem interested in honoring the extended warranty that they issued for this product, which is your first indicator that I didn't receive a lemon, but there is an issue with the entire product line (or at least a high failure rate).  I would not recommend buying this product because most issues seem to appear outside the return window of Amazon, at which point you will be at the mercy of Microsoft's return/replacement policy - good luck with that.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 19, 2020
CommentsContent: If you like FPS games like me this is a great controller, much better than the reg controllers, comfy in my hands and you can adjust the thumbstick tension add kontrol freaks to thumbsticks, remap buttons etc etc, however I returned mine because mouse and keyboard are is soo much better, I bought a razer black widow elite  keyboard and logitech g600mouse this past winter and now controllers just don't do it for me, but if you wish to stick with controller's this is the one, and yes you can use on pc and pc is soo much better than console

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2020
CommentsContent: I've ordered three controllers and I've had the same problems with all three. That being the face buttons aren't consistently responsive. Which is a necessity for any type of game. CommentsContent: Superior controller with a great feel and excellent customization. The tension adjustment on the sticks are the best feature. I really liked the ability to load 3 profiles for different games. The controller is fantastic but I have to ding Microsoft for the mediocre/subpar software to customize the controller. However, the controller is far superior to the original controller. USB-C connection is nice and brings a fast charge into the world of controllers. I’ve got about 25 hours off one charge, which is incredible.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2020
CommentsContent: So there are plenty of people having issues with their Elite Series 2s. I’m not going to discount their claims but I will say that I have yet to have issues with mine in particular. CommentsTitle: technical issues and also ongoing issues beware

Well it doesn't mean anything if its supposed to do this and be wireless, constant disconnections and if I don't feel like dancing around trying to get it to work I just plug it in. CommentsContent: First review ever and own two original elite controllers both are great controllers except for the series 2. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2019
CommentsContent: I have owned 2 different generation 1 elite controllers and had issues with both. The first has a loose right stick, which I had replaced under warranty with a brand new controller. I love the ability to adjust tension in the sticks, especially for shooters. I also like the smaller paddles, because I can set the controller down and they won’t activate.My only fear is the internal battery eventually becoming weak over time. So far I have been careful to only charge the controller when the battery gives me a warning. So far the battery has lasted 16+ hours on a single charge. I recommend this controller for anyone who wants to have a little more advantage in games and who enjoys tweaking the hardware to personalize your gaming experience.

CommentsTitle: On a second one in less than 6 months...

CommentsContent: Out of the box this controller felt sturdy and looked awesome. This controller has been an upsetting disappointment, do not recommend for longevity and at this price I'm sure you'd want to use it for at least a year.

CommentsTitle: The best controller I have ever owned. . .

CommentsContent: I had the original Xbox One Elite controller, which was already a masterpiece. CommentsTitle: Stick Drift is a big problem.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I first received a controller where LT did not function at all. I returned that one and received another promptly in the mail. The first month was fine, enough time to expire the warranty, but just after about a month of regular use the left joystick started to drift. If you don’t know what stick drift is, after holding a direction on the joystick for a while when you let it go it gets stuck a little off center and the stick starts to drift in that direction. I did some research and found that a lot of people have this problem with the controller because of one cheap plastic part on the inside. I primarily use this controller for shooters, and the stick drifting is very distracting to my aim. The paddles are great but I recommend finding another brand of controller with paddles. A problem as simple as this should not occur in a controller worth more than $150.

CommentsTitle: Great, until it's NOT... Paddle Joints poorly constructed

CommentsTitle: Love this thing after a small modification

CommentsTitle: Best ever controller. Just 2 problems I’ve had
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2020
CommentsContent: The bests controller I’ve ever had, does exactly what is advertised. The first one had RB double clicks so I had to try and exchange it at Walmart where I bought it, since corona happened there was none in stock so they lady already took the controller wherever damages go, so I had to order here on Amazon in May, thankfully they came back in stock soon enough and only took a week and a half to send in. It worked perfectly up until somehow the inside of the right trigger the padding fell off which has never happened to me before in any controller. CommentsTitle: Broken after 1 year of light use.

CommentsTitle: Hardware Issues, Terrible Microsoft Warranty and Customer Service

CommentsTitle: Avoid, build quality is sub-par and warranty is a sham.

CommentsTitle: Unfortunately a waste of money in my case
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2020
CommentsContent: Honestly I was really excited to get my first elite controller, but this thing has been nothing but a disappointment. CommentsTitle: Hope there's a Microsoft Store near you
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought mine here because there was a good deal on it, but when I received it I noticed one of the back right paddles wasn't catching on the part inside the controller that holds it in place and allows the paddle to press the actual button. CommentsTitle: Like everyone else said, it broke quick
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I ignored the other reviews, played the odds, and lost.When it works, the product is fantastic. Good weight. Felt solid. Customizable. It was a joy to use. But it lasted 2 months. Fortunately, mine died within the warranty, so I get a replacement - other weren't so lucky.I wouldn't chance it. There is no excuse for a nearly $200 controller to routinely break so quickly. Honestly, I only really wanted the back paddles. Maybe the right play was to get set that clipped onto my old controller. Too late now.Update: I just got my replacement controller. After about 5 hours of use my A button is sticking a bit (I hardly use this button - mapped the back paddle to be A).

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Holding this controller feels great! The quality and weight just feel expensive. Mapping the buttons is easy to do with the accessories app on Xbox/PC. I think this controller is well worth the money...except for one major problem. The face butttons(A, B, X, Y), particularly the A Button, have a hardware issue that causes the button to work intermittently. Sometimes the button doesn't register a press if pressed lightly or off-center. This is particularly noticeable in platformers and fighting games, where precision button presses are key. You can map the affected button to a different button or the paddles on the back and it works just fine. Microsoft is aware of this issue, it's pretty well known as of now, hopefully they'll have a resolution soon. As of today, 3/11/20, I received my first replacement and the A Button is having the exact same issue. I'll be returning this one for another replacement soon. It still gets 4 stars because everything else about this controller, EVERYTHING ELSE, is perfect!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 27, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought one this controller a few of months ago. Initially everything worked as you might expect from a $180 controller. After 4 weeks the RB button started to not respond when pressed. Despite hearing the resounding click when pressed it was not responding unless applying an extra amount of pressure. I called Microsoft, explained issure and sent controller in and they sent back a new one.Once again everything worked great. Right after about 1 month again, I noticed the RB button wouldn't respond just as the previous controller. With the standard controllers I have never had this problem. Typically I'll use a controller for 2 years before replacing it (usually still issue free). I typically wouldn't be so critical on this problem, but if you are gonna sell a "superior" controller for 3 times the price of a standard one, it better be dang near flawless for at least a year of use. CommentsTitle: The Best Premium Xbox One Controller You Can Gat
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2019
CommentsContent: While I have never owned the original elite controller, I have used the similarly priced scuf Prestige and can hopefully shed some light on the features that each have to offer.First of all, you can tell right from opening the box that an extensive amount of R&D muscle was flexed in the making of this controller. The case is nice and compact, the controller feels heavy and we'll assembled, with no loose pieces on the actual unit other than the magnetically attached paddles on the back. It looks and feels like a premium controller should.Now, what about the features that separate it from a regular Xbox one controller? The built in plastic grip is surprisingly ergonomic and is about as comfortable as on the Prestige. The ergonomics of the controller in general feel much improved if you have medium to large hands. This is particularly noticeable in the placement of the paddles. The prestige's paddles we're bigger and attached more firmly, but the Elite 2's paddles are placed perfectly in just the right spot where my otherwise unused digits rest in the middle of the controller, making them much easier to manipulate.Then we have the hair triggers, and man, I am absolutely in love with these things. I tend to bounce back and forth from FPS games to racing, RPG, etc. and having the ability to switch to a decrease trigger pull length on the fly is easily the second biggest advantage of these premium controller options. While the scuf prestige only offered two setting options, this one has three. Even more importantly, the hair triggers are specifically calibrated so that there is a micrometer or so if give before they start sending input. This is crucial, as my scuf prestige would often respond to the slightest touch and even registered some input when I wasn't touching the controller at all.This leads into another feature that puts this controller well ahead of the prestige: it's integration with the Xbox accessories app. The prestige is essentially a bunch of hardware additions and modifications slapped onto the original controller. The Elite V2 is an entirely different animal. You can set specific button/paddle layouts which allow you to switch to them on the fly, and even designate a shift paddle/button to switch to another layout nomentarily. You can visually inspect the pressure curve of the hair triggers at different settings. Feel like your right thumbstick is too twitchy? Switch from the default linear input curve to a more gradual one. All this and more is available to you within seconds of opening the app.While it is certainly an investment, this controller has quickly become the best I have ever used. The love and care that was out into it's design was obvious, and I intend to use it at every opportunity.

As yet, it is untested electronically as I plan to use it on my PC, but the adapter has not arrived. I hope the controller performs well, it is beautiful. All parts came in, they weren't in place but they are all here. Everything really surprised me, considering my last xbox controller was from the Halo 3 edition Xbox 360.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 21, 2020
CommentsContent: Feels nice, looks nice, extra buttons....that's it. Yes you can customize it a bit, but its not worth $100 more than the original. You also have to retrain your muscle memory to use the triggers properly. I found myself not really using them that much either and felt more of a delay with the triggers than the buttons themselves (mostly due to my muscle memory).Can't recommend this unless you really need more triggers.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2020
CommentsContent: Straight out of the box the D-Pad made a sticky noise whenever it's pressed. I thought it'll go away after usage but if anything, it got worse. I went the local Microsoft store to replace it but they indicated that they were out of stock and there's a waiting list. They then told me it's best to go through Amazon for a replacement. I'm ordering a replacement now and will update the review if it's the same issue or worse like the other reviews.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 4, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a real review from a real gamer who plays a lot of COD.  These controllers are a amazing. The 3 stars is due to the fact that they keep breaking.  The stick drift is going to happen.  Just depends how bad.  I'm on my third one. Luckily my last one broke within the 3 month warranty. However at this point I can't play with any other controller. When these work there's nothing like it. But for $170 bucks you'd like them to work for longer than 2 months or so.  There's NO customer service at Microsoft.  So buy one if you have money. Just don't expect it to hold up.

CommentsTitle: Awful durability, everything else is perfect
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 3, 2020
CommentsContent: The paddles, trigger stops, and customizable accessories are all perfect with the controller. The paddles are in a perfect position and very comfortable. The trigger stops work great and give you an edge when needing to click quickly. The ability to use a taller stick in first person shooters significantly helps the fine movements and increases your aim. But after about 90 days the left bumper started to stick and and I am now only able to click it once every 15 seconds or so. The left stick click also gave out about the same time. Clicking it repeatedly for a few seconds will get it to register but does not work 95% of the time. Contacted Microsoft to have it fixed, was told I would get an email from the support team to have it sent back. Never got an email. Contacted them via phone and was unable to get to a live person. Contacted them again through email and was told that my warranty expired and that there's nothing they would do unless I paid them. Got roughly 200 hours of use out of the controller and spent about 200$. A dollar for every hour of play time before the controller gives out. As nice as the controller is when it works, this was my worst purchase ever.

CommentsTitle: Unreliable + Unacceptably short warranty = DO NOT BUY
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 5, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Up until the controller stopped functioning as advertised, this controller was great! Great weight, internal rechargeable battery and adjustable triggers. That all ended when the rear paddle mapped to the 'B' button started to intermittently fail to register input. In the included video you can see how bad it gets. I figured I'd contact Microsoft for support, I had a similar issue with my 1st Gen Elite Controller and they fixed it within a week under warranty.Which leads me to my 1 star review. I understand complex electronics fail sometimes, what I can't understand is how a company like Microsoft can sell a product this expensive with a paltry 90 day warranty. That's absurd, 1 year warranties are ubiquitous at this point. I won't be buying Microsoft hardware without a full year warranty. Their hardware products are simply not up to the standards available in the market today.

CommentsTitle: Better than Original Elite! Ignore the negative reviews.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2020
CommentsContent: This controller is a definite upgrade from the 1st edition Elite! Don’t listen to the negative reviews about buttons being sticky or RB button being broken on arrival, If you just take good care of it. Aside from that, this controller feels comfortable, heavy in a good way due to the built in rechargeable battery. The battery is a big plus on this controller as well, it’s rechargeable with USB type C! What more could you want in a high end competitive controller? You can add the original elite paddles to this new one just fine. Although the series 2 paddles are a bit smaller but have a better response with hearing yourself click them which can be great if your into that. All in all this an amazing controller compared to the original elite. My original elite went through a lot of self repairs but I’ve owned it for 3-4 years so it lasted me long enough for the Series 2. Get this controller if your in need of an upgrade or are new to elite controllers the series 2 is a hands down better choice regardless of the price. IT WORTH IT!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2020
CommentsContent: This controller feels great in the hand. Its nice and heavy and feels really well built. The face buttons feel really nice but the X and A are strangely loud when you press them. Unfortunately after only a few hours of using it the A button is only registering about 1/2 of the time, which is absolutely unacceptable for any controller let alone one that costs so much .  Apparently this is a very common issue and buying one of these is somewhat of a gamble as to whether or not you get a good one.  I'm going to have to return this one and give it one more chance.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2020

My problems only really showed up after a few months of use, so I thought I was okay because the pamphlet THAT COMES IN THE BOX says it has a ONE YEAR warranty, right? NOPE! 90 days only. So now I'm stuck with a expensive paperweight that only "sometimes" works. My regular Xbox One S controller that I've had for over a year now has NEVER had any issues at all. I was so excited to get this controller and while it worked, it was amazing, but this complete misdirection of the warranty is purposely malicious, I will never be buying another Microsoft product in my life.

CommentsTitle: Good controller but you cannot rely on it

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2020

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2020
CommentsContent: I upgraded from the series 1 to the series 2 for the adjustable resistance on the analog sticks. One of my biggest complaints of any controller has been how "soft" the analog joysticks move. I love that with a few twist of the internal component of the joysticks stiffens up the joysticks. The adjustable 3 stage triggers are nice as well. My favorite feature though is the internal battery. I've tried AA batteries, rechargeable batteries, battery packs on the series 1 and never got more than a day of two (if I was lucky) of gaming out of them. The saving of batteries was worth the purchase alone. It is probably the best designed controller I've used.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 13, 2020
